greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = a(1) + a(2) + ... + a(n-1) - a(m) for n >= 4, where m = 2*n - 2 - 2^(p+1) and p is the unique integer such that 2^p < n - 1 <= 2^(p+1), starting with a(1) = a(2) = 1 and a(3) = 2.
program: (PARI) lista(nn) = { nn = max(nn, 3); my(va = vector(nn)); va[1] = 1; va[2] = 1; va[3] = 2; my(sa = vecsum(va)); for (n=4, nn, va[n] = sa - va[2*(n - 1 - 2^logint(n-2, 2))]; sa += va[n]; ); va; } \\ _Petros Hadjicostas_, May 03 2020
xref: Cf. A049890 (similar with minus a(m/2)), A049938 (similar with plus a(m/2)), A049939 (similar with plus a(m)).
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_
